intro: Eleocharis tricostata, commonly known as the three-costate sedge, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often found in temperate regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Its inflorescence consists of numerous tiny, three-lobed flowers that are wind-pollinated. Eleocharis tricostata plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
